content.question: The 1854 Kansas-Nebraska Act instituted popular sovereignty to

choices.label: prohibit slavery above Missouriâ€™s southern border
assure that Congress had a constitutional right to establish or abolish slavery in new territories
allow people living in a territory to determine whether slavery should be permitted there
admit Kansas as a slave state and Nebraska as a free state
allow towns to decide the issue of slavery on a case-by-case basis

content.answer: allow people living in a territory to determine whether slavery should be permitted there

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
